page.title: 03WIVENHOE 40 YEARS AGO
page.content: She said it was about 1700. She also told us there had been two shipyards working then and there were 11 public houses in the town. Next we asked about the newspapers and comics they used to read. They read the "Daily Worker" and on Sundays they used to read the "News of the World". Children had their own newspaper called "The Children's Newspaper". There were also comics like "Modern Boy", "The Scout", "Girls' Own" and "Comic Cuts". Jane's Grandad could also remember reading "Tiger Tim's Weekly". Jane Douzier and Louise Bland
